revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - Agreed. HGV refers to the reproduction and there's no need to repeat the information. So, 'from photo'.
Vote - AcceptText - Fine. In the apparatus, perhaps simply "(from plate)" instead of "(Plate AncSoc 10 (1979) 153)"?

Submit - Change to l. 7 according to BL X 225; I also propose a new reading for l. 4 based on the photograph in AncSoc 10 (1979) 153. That which had been read as alpha-rho is actually a biggish ny with a small curved trait on the right. It is comparable to the final ny at in the same participle. The reading also allows to make better sense of the text: the kleroi had been confiscated after the sowing schedule, so the administration had, for that year, no influence on what should be cultivated on them. In the apparatus I would have rather written (AncSoc 10 [1979] 153), but the addition of square brackets produced an error.
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; changed sic to surplus; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek; tagged num rend=fraction
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
